title: If gold doesn't exist, would society function any differently? - Quora

response.answer_text: If gold never existed, society would use a different scarce resource as the foundation of currency. Historically, tulips and salt have been highly valued. People’s underlying perspective on value or currency will not be changed by removing gold from the world. It would be shifted to another asset (resource). Whether its coconuts or oil, the economy will find an underlying asset.
